pages.text: The $(9)Coercion Deriver$() is a member of the MFFS family of machines. It is primarily used to generate $(l:mffs:getting_started/fortron)Fortron$() from FE energy, which other MFFS machines require to function. A $(9)Coercion Deriver$() is designed to work in conjunction with a $(l:mffs:machines/fortron_capacitor)Fortron Capacitor$() to charge it with $(l:mffs:getting_started/fortron)Fortron$(). $(l:mffs:getting_started/fortron)Fortron$() is then distributed to the other machines by the Capacitor.

pages.title: Usage
pages.text: To generate $(l:mffs:getting_started/fortron)Fortron$(), connect the $(9)Coercion Deriver$() to a FE source and activate it using a Redstone signal. Once powered and activated, the $(9)Coercion Deriver$() will change from red to blue and begin generating $(l:mffs:getting_started/fortron)Fortron$(). A $(9)Coercion Deriver$() may be linked to other MFFS machines, such as a $(l:mffs:machines/fortron_capacitor)Fortron Capacitor$(), by setting its frequency number to match that of the other machines.

This can be achieved by either:$(li)Right-clicking the Deriver and entering the desired frequency number into its GUI screen$(li)Shift-right-clicking the Coercion Deriver while holding a Frequency Card$(p)The $(9)Coercion Deriver$()'s ability to generate $(l:mffs:getting_started/fortron)Fortron$() can be amplified using $(2)Lapis Lazuli$() or $(2)Nether Quartz$(). For this, place either into the slot next to the arrow. This should increase $(l:mffs:getting_started/fortron)Fortron$() output by about 20x.

pages.title: Operation Modes
pages.text: The $(9)Coercion Deriver$() has two modes of operation: Derive and Integrate. By default, the it is set to Derive - meaning it steadily converts supplied FE into $(l:mffs:getting_started/fortron)Fortron$(). Clicking the $(2)Derive$() toggle button in the middle of the GUI screen switches its operating mode to $(2)Integrate$() and vice versa. In Integrate mode, the Deriver operates in reverse by converting available $(l:mffs:getting_started/fortron)Fortron$() back into FE.

pages.title: Upgradability
pages.text: A Coercion Deriver may be augmented with various modules to improve its performance.$(li)$(l:mffs:upgrade_modules/speed_module)$(5)Speed Module$(): Increases the boosting effect gained when inserting $(2)Lapis Lazuli$() or $(2)Nether Quartz$() into the Deriver.$(li)$(l:mffs:upgrade_modules/capacity_module)$(5)Capacity Module$(): Increases the amount of $(l:mffs:getting_started/fortron)Fortron$() the Deriver is able to store.$()
